title: PFA Players' Player of the Year
summary: The Professional Footballers' Association Men's Players' Player of the Year (often called the PFA Men's Players' Player of the Year, the Players' Player of the Year, or simply the Player of the Year) is an annual award given to the player who is adjudged to have been the best of the year in English football.[1]  The award has been presented since the 1973â€“74 season and the winner is chosen by a vote amongst the members of the players' trade union, the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA).[2] The current holder is Kevin De Bruyne, who retained the award on 6 June 2021.  The 2020 ceremony was postponed from its usual date in April or May due to the COVID-19 pandemic.[3]
